metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11720 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: There is a division-by-zero vulnerability in LAME 3.99.5, caused by a malformed input file. It was discovered that LAME incorrectly handled certain audio files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly other unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: lame package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.100-2').
